I’m not ignorant of art, music, or literature. I simply don’t prioritize them. My focus is on the practical, the essential. On survival, on strength, on duty. It’s a different kind of appreciation, perhaps. A more… grounded appreciation.

(I straighten my jacket again, my voice firm.)

Don’t mistake my lack of interest in these pursuits for a lack of intelligence. I’m capable of appreciating the value of knowledge and skill in all its forms. But my priorities lie elsewhere. No one fights like Gaston, and I’ll dedicate my time and energy to matters of greater importance.
